document.masterDocTitle: A taxonomic revision of the Elachista bedellella (Sircom) complex (Lepidoptera: Elachistidae: Elachistinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A taxonomic revision of the Elachista bedellella (Sircom) complex (Lepidoptera: Elachistidae: Elachistinae)

1 ď [collector not stated] (L. Kaila prep. 3512 , MHNG ).

Diagnosis. A pale species with indistinct ochreous or brownish irroration on the forewing (
Figs. 3–6
). This species is distinct from
E. bedellella
not only by the difference in appearance but also in characteristics in both male and female genitalia. In the male genitalia these species differ by the very broad barrel-shaped phallus of
E. lugdunensis
that contains a cornutus consisting of small sclerotised plate with a long stout and straight tooth (
Figs. 58
C, D). The juxta lobes of
E. lugdunensis
are long and narrow (best seen in lateral view) (
Fig. 20
). For identification of the female genitalia, see the diagnosis of
E. bedellella
above.
Distribution. SW Europe ( France , Germany , Spain , Switzerland ).

Remarks.
Traugott-Olsen ( 1985 )
depicts the genitalia of the holotype of
Elachista coeneni
Traugott- Olsen; the characteristic cornutus of
E. lugdunensis
is well visible in the illustration.
